title: The Liberation Of Ilia
opening: After defeating Sigune, Roy headed for Edessa, located in the southeast of Ilia. Castle Edessa, owned by Zelot, leader of the Ilian mercenary knights, once served as the headquarters of the Pegasus Knight squads as well. However, with Zelot gone, Bern saw its chance and attacked the castle, seizing it and forcing the mercenaries and Pegasus Knights into submission.

Castle Edessa was Murdock’s headquarters, but since Murdock had returned to Bern, Roartz was put in charge. Alarmed by the Etrurian Army’s speed in advancing on to Edessa, Roartz hurriedly contacted the various Ilian knight groups asking them for aid. However, their replies were not promising.

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: Well? Have we got enough troops?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Well... We are requesting aid from Ilia’s knights, but all of them except those that have been given direct orders from Lord Murdock are hesitant to help us.

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: Damn! How could this happen... ...Ah, we had captured Zelot’s wife and his family. How about Zelot’s group? Have they responded?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: No... They have been traveling all over the continent as mercenary knights, so we do not even know their exact location.

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: Damn...

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Ever since Sigune’s group was defeated, all of Ilia’s militia have been reluctant to fight the Etrurian Army.

intro.speaker: Roartz
intro.line: Blast! Everyone, everyone is such a coward! They would have me, top advisor to the Etrurian Court, die in a place like this!?

intro.speaker: Old Woman
intro.line: Cough, cough...

intro.speaker: Juno
intro.line: Are you all right? Here, take my shawl.

intro.speaker: Old Woman
intro.line: N-No, then you would be cold...

intro.speaker: Juno
intro.line: It’s all right, I’m used to the cold. It’s far better than flying through the blizzards on a pegasus.

intro.speaker: Old Woman
intro.line: ...Thank you. Cough, cough...

intro.speaker: Girl
intro.line: Lady Juno... What’s going to happen to us?

intro.speaker: Juno
intro.line: ...I don’t know. But we must have hope. Perhaps the enemy might leave, or perhaps Zelot might return. We must not give up hope.

intro.speaker: Girl
intro.line: ...Where is Lord Zelot now?

intro.speaker: Juno
intro.line: In his last letter he said that he was joining the Lycia Alliance Army, but after that... Well, he could be closer that we think he is.

intro.speaker: Girl
intro.line: I hope you’re right.

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: ...We fight again today.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Yes. When we take this castle, we can use it as a base to launch attacks on Bern.

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: ...Yes.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Princess... May I ask the reason why Bern’s former king tried to murder King Zephiel?

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: ...Zephiel and I were born from different mothers. I am actually only his half-sister.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: I heard that Zephiel’s mother was the queen of Etruria.

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: Yes. It was an arranged marriage to strengthen the tie between Bern and Etruria. However, our father already had a woman he loved at that time. She is my mother.

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: The marriage between our father and Zephiel’s mother was forced. Therefore, our father didn’t love Zephiel’s mother, and always thought badly of Zephiel.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Then is that why the former king and King Zephiel had a bad relationship?

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: No... Even then, Zephiel was always trying his best to gain our father’s affection. He excelled in his studies and military training, and he was always trying hard. He grew to become a proud heir to Bern’s throne.

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: Then why did the king try to...

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Master Roy! We are ready for the attack!

intro.speaker: Roy
intro.line: All right, I’ll be there in a minute! Princess Guinevere, I’m sorry, but...

intro.speaker: Guinevere
intro.line: No, it is all right. Please be careful.

battle.speaker: Roy
battle.line: The blizzard is picking up… This might take longer than we expected. We should head for Bern as soon as we take the castle.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zelot
recruit-talk.line: Juno!

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Zelot!

recruit-talk.speaker: Zelot
recruit-talk.line: Are you all right? You’re not hurt? They didn’t do anything terrible to you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Oh, Zelot, I am no child. I am the ex-flightleader of the Pegasus Knight Fleet, you know.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zelot
recruit-talk.line: That’s true, but...

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: I’m all right. I’m not hurt or anything.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zelot
recruit-talk.line: Good...

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Why are you in the Etrurian Army? I thought you were with the Lycia Alliance.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zelot
recruit-talk.line: Well, it’s a long story... Anyway, this is the Etrurian Army only by name. It is actually made up of troops from the Lycia Alliance Army.

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Oh... I see.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zelot
recruit-talk.line: I’m sorry. I couldn’t be at the castle when I was needed the most...

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: There’s no point in dwelling on the past.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zelot
recruit-talk.line: But you had to go out and fight...

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Oh? Don’t you like my flightleader outfit?

recruit-talk.speaker: Zelot
recruit-talk.line: Of course I do! But...

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Then there’s no problem. You’ll be seeing a lot of it from now on.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zelot
recruit-talk.line: What! Do you mean...

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Yes. I will fight alongside you as well.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zelot
recruit-talk.line: No! No no no. You retired long ago. So just leave the fighting to us...

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Even after I retired, I had to fight anyway. Zelot, there is no safe place in the world any more.

recruit-talk.speaker: Zelot
recruit-talk.line: Well...

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: So I will fight, so I can help bring a time of peace all the more quickly.

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: Juno!

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Thea... What are you doing here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: It’s a long story... But anyway, I’m with the Etrurian Army now. I heard Edessa had fallen to Bern, and I was worried, but... I’m glad to see you’re all right.

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: ...I thought you were originally fighting for the people who were fighting against the Etrurian Army. You didn’t...

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: No! I didn’t go against the Ilian Mercenary Code. I fulfilled my duties as a mercenary and then joined the Etrurian Army.

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Of course... You’re a good and diligent girl. You wouldn’t do something like that. I’m sorry.

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: No, it’s all right... And, um... What are you wearing?

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: This? Why, this is my military outfit, as you very well know. Well, what do you think? Don’t you think I can still go on as flightleader?

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: But... I thought you retired.

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: I can’t be saying that in this time of emergency! On my own, all I could do was rescue the people in the castle, but if I joined you, I could fight against Bern as well.

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: So you’re going to fight alongside us?

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Yes.

recruit-talk.speaker: Thea
recruit-talk.line: Yes! I never thought I could fight alongside you again.

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Don’t get cocky now. I haven’t gotten too rusty yet either!

recruit-talk.speaker: Shanna
recruit-talk.line: Big Sister Juno!

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Shanna? Why are you here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Shanna
recruit-talk.line: I’ve been in the Etrurian Army. I was surprised when I heard that Edessa got taken by Bern, but I knew you’d be okay!

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Oh? Why do you say that?

recruit-talk.speaker: Shanna
recruit-talk.line: You were captain of the Fleet! There’s no way Bern could defeat you.

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Thank you. Well, you’ll be sorry to hear that I was captured.

recruit-talk.speaker: Shanna
recruit-talk.line: Well, that’s...

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: But I won’t stay defeated by Bern for long. On my own, all I could do was rescue the people in the castle, but if I joined you, I could fight against Bern as well.

recruit-talk.speaker: Shanna
recruit-talk.line: Then are you going to fight with us?

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Yes.

recruit-talk.speaker: Shanna
recruit-talk.line: Really? Yes!

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: Does that make you so excited?

recruit-talk.speaker: Shanna
recruit-talk.line: Yes! I became a Pegasus Knight because I wanted to be like you. Fighting alongside you is like a dream.

recruit-talk.speaker: Juno
recruit-talk.line: My, my... Well, you always did tend to go overboard with things...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Next is Bern...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Master Roy! Part of Bern’s army is hiding in the ruins on the outskirts of Edessa!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Ruins?

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: Yes. Apparently, in them lies a spear that was used during the Scouring.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What? That spear...

end.speaker: Merlinus
end.line: It is most probably a Divine Weapon.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: We must hurry to the ruins!

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Princess Guinevere, we will attack Bern now. So may I ask...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...The rest of the story.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: King Zephiel was an outstanding pupil is his studies, he was skilled in warcraft... He grew to be the perfect heir for the king.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: That is correct.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: But still, the former king did not look kindly at him.

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: In fact... Our father began to hate Zephiel because he grew to become such a brilliant and worthy youth.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What...is that supposed to mean...?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Our father was a man of ordinary skill and intellect. Therefore, Zephiel’s outstanding skill made our father cold towards him.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Jealousy...?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: And then one day, our father told Zephiel that ‘the next heir to Bern would be Guinevere’s husband.'

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: What! That’s awful!

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: But Zephiel was very patient. He said that he did not mind even if he could not gain the throne. But the people around us, who were looking forward to Zephiel’s ability to be a good king, would not allow anyone else to be the heir. Pressured by the public, our father lost his patience at last, and...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Decided to kill King Zephiel...?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: At a banquet, our father gave Zephiel a poisoned drink from his own hands. And that was the first and last cup that Zephiel took from our father. After returning to his room, Zephiel started to get sick. For ten days and nights, Zephiel lingered between life and death. But Murdock, Zephiel’s teacher and loyal general, saved his life.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: ...The former king never did anything after that?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: No... But I have heard that he had plans to get rid of Murdock and Zephiel’s mother as traitors. He was scheming to murder them all along with Zephiel. After hearing that, Zephiel made believe that he was dead. Our father then checked the coffin to confirm Zephiel’s death. At that moment, Zephiel rose up from the coffin and...with his sword...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: I was but a child then, so naturally I could not have understood what was going on. All I knew is that after our father died, Zephiel never smiled again. Until then, he was strict at times, but he was always a kind and loving brother to me. So...

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Princess...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: So I... At the bottom of my heart, I trust that Zephiel can change, that he can become that loving brother again. I...had to take action.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I...see...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...But now, my brother is in a place where my words cannot reach him. Roy, please... Please stop him. Please stop him from inflicting pain and suffering to the people of Bern...and the rest of Elibe.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: Even if it may resolve to the blade?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...I have made my resolve when I entrusted this task to you.

end.speaker: Roy
end.line: I see. You have my word and loyalty, Princess Guinevere. I swear to the Fire Emblem that I will stop King Zephiel!

end.speaker: Girl
end.line: Excuse me...

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: Yes...?

end.speaker: Girl
end.line: Are you the one who saved us?

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: No, I am...

end.speaker: Girl
end.line: Thank you! Thanks to you, we can now stand here safely. Please accept this token of our gratitude.

end.speaker: Old Woman
end.line: Thank you!

end.speaker: Guinevere
end.line: ...... I shall hand this to Roy...
